content: Does everyone else get a little bit of glee when Grahame responds to someone's issue? I'm always thinking "he's awake! we're going to get some answers now!" :)

Jean Duteau said:

Does everyone else get a little bit of glee when Grahame responds to someone's issue? I'm always thinking "he's awake! we're going to get some answers now!" :smile:

LOL .... but Godot represents death, and waiting for Grahame is certainly not like waiting for THAT!
I just get sad when I see he's up really late helping you guys and figure he's never going to wake up to help me. Though, now I'm thinking he just doesn't really sleep that much...
It's quid pro qou however: for every answer you receive from Grahame, you've got to answer 5 questions by noobs ;-)
I thought you said Gadot .... wonder what I was thinking about>

René Spronk said:

For every answer you receive from Grahame, you've got to answer 5 questions by noobs ;-)

This! That's the community spirit!

René Spronk said:

It's quid pro qou however: for every answer you receive from Grahame, you've got to answer 5 questions by noobs ;-)

We should add this as a community rule
It's the "pay it forward" rule of every robust community - and not just online ones!
[needs to ask GG something else...] Come on noobs where are the questions!
The reality is that FHIR is so broad, we're all noobs in some topic or other :)

Kevin Mayfield said:

I thought you said Gadot .... wonder what I was thinking about>

Christmas Day?
that would be cool if Gal Gadot was a FHIR expert....

Rik Smithies said:

[needs to ask GG something else...] Come on noobs where are the questions!

Which GG - Grahame Grieve or Gal Gadot?
I can't keep up anymore. but I think you'd be better off if Gal Godot answered your questions

Grahame Grieve said:

I can't keep up anymore. but I think you'd be better off if Gal Godot answered your questions

Well it depends on what the question is, now doesn't it.

Could SHE answer authoritatively on whether Task is the best FHIR resource for patient corrections to chart errors?
Ooo, now he's going all Zen on us.
